name: Outlawed
description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

key_work.title: The Story of the Kelly Gang
key_work.credit_line: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia.
key_work.brief_description: Produced in Melbourne in 1906, The Story of the Kelly Gang is the world’s first feature-length film. While most movies of its era only ran for about 12 minutes, Charles Tait’s bushranger epic went for over an hour.

constellations_primary.name: Outlawed
constellations_primary.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_other.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

constellations_other.name: True blue, true crime
constellations_other.description: Robert Connolly's The Dry is a recent Australian crime blockbuster, but the writer, director and producer's first film (and first crime film) connects to a longstanding tradition of true-blue crime stories from some of our greatest filmmakers.

end.title: Red Dead Redemption 2
end.brief_description: Developed by the creators of Grand Theft Auto V and Red Dead Redemption, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an epic tale of life in America’s unforgiving heartland. The game’s vast and atmospheric world will also provide the foundation for a brand new online multiplayer experience.

constellations_other.name: The radical power of the glitch
constellations_other.description: Brian Eno said, “Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature.” Videogame glitches can seem annoying or obstructive – but for the artists in Out of Bounds, they offer radical creative potential.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

links.description: In Red Dead Redemption 2 players can don Ned Kelly’s famous armour, which in the game draws on the visual power of the armour itself as much as the Australian outlaw mythology.

start.title: Red Dead Redemption 2

end.title: Seven Samurai

video_links.name: Seven Samurai (1954) Original Japanese Theatrical Trailer

end.brief_description: A samurai answers a village’s request for protection after he falls on hard times. The town needs protection from bandits, so the samurai gathers six others to help him teach the people how to defend themselves when the bandits attack.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

constellations_other.name: Eighties hunks
constellations_other.description: Thor’s hero costume from Thor: Love and Thunder was inspired by classic comics of the 80s. Gone are the military greys, replaced with bright golds and bold colours. Let’s take a look at the lineage of 80s action heroes to which this version of Thor belongs.

constellations_other.name: Storyboards to Academy Awards
constellations_other.description: Storyboards allow filmmakers, showrunners and game designers to visualise and communicate how their stories will look on-screen.

links.description: Unlike the rebellious Ned Kelly, the central characters in Red Dead Redemption 2 seek redemption in the tradition of Seven Samurai‘s Ronin (masterless samurai), who try to regain honour by defending a small village.

end.title: Westworld

video_links.name: Westworld - Official Trailer - Warner Bros. UK

end.brief_description: A dark odyssey about the dawn of artificial consciousness and the evolution of sin, set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, Westworld explores a world in which every human appetite, noble or depraved, can be indulged.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

links.description: Akira Kurosawa’s classic kickstarted a cinematic cultural exchange, staring with the loose US remake of Seven Samurai, The Magnificent Seven. This western/samurai film exchange is referenced in Westworld, where characters escape robotic cowboys only to encounter AI samurai.

end.title: Ned Kelly (VR)
end.brief_description: Ian MacLarty’s Ned Kelly VR game, made in Vertex Meadow, lets players inhabit the limited view of the famous bushranger’s iconic helmet.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

links.description: Westworld applies an Orientalist lens to expose the limitations of representation for samurai. VR game Ned Kelly suggests the limited scope of the colonial perspective by liming the player’s POV to the rectangular slit of Kelly’s helmet.

start.title: Ned Kelly (VR)
start.brief_description: Ian MacLarty’s Ned Kelly VR game, made in Vertex Meadow, lets players inhabit the limited view of the famous bushranger’s iconic helmet.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

end.title: Sweet Country
end.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Heather Wallace, David Jowsey, Greer Simpkin, Bunya Productions, Tony Cronin, David Tranter and Steven McGregor
end.brief_description: It’s 1929 on the vast, desert-like, Eastern Arrernte Nation lands that are now known as the Central Australian outback. Sam Kelly, a middle-aged Aboriginal man, works the land of a kind preacher, Fred Smith. After an ill-tempered bully arrives in town and Kelly kills him in self-defence, he and his wife go on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

constellations_primary.name: Sweet Country
constellations_primary.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: The limited perspective in Ned Kelly is similar to a scene in Sweet Country when The Story of the Kelly Gang is screened to Australian settlers who cheer for the folk hero while baying for the blood of Aboriginal outlaw protagonist Sam Kelly.

start.credit_line: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia.
start.brief_description: Produced in Melbourne in 1906, The Story of the Kelly Gang is the world’s first feature-length film. While most movies of its era only ran for about 12 minutes, Charles Tait’s bushranger epic went for over an hour.

end.title: The Great Train Robbery
end.creator_credit: Edwin S. Porter and Scott Marble
end.brief_description: Edwin S Porter’s The Great Train Robbery is considered one of the first westerns (and action films), which made use of many filmmaking techniques that were unconventional at the time including composite editing, on-location shooting, and frequent camera movement.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

links.description: The Story of the Kelly Gang is inspired by Edwin S Porter’s The Great Train Robbery. However, where as the former focused on the aggression of the outlaws, The Story of the Kelly Gang tapped into Kelly’s status as a folk hero.
